title: Maximum Depth of Binary Tree
description: Given the root of a binary tree, return its maximum depth. The maximum depth is the number of nodes along the longest path from the root down to the farthest leaf node.
constraints: The number of nodes in the tree is in the range [0, 10^4].

templates.python:
class TreeNode:
    def __init__(self, val=0, left=None, right=None):
        self.val = val
        self.left = left
        self.right = right

class Solution:
    def maxDepth(self, root):
        # Your code here
        return 0

# Driver code - DO NOT MODIFY
def buildTree(data):
    if data == "[]":
        return None
    values = data[1:-1].split(',')
    root = TreeNode(int(values[0].strip()))
    queue = [root]
    i = 1
    
    while queue and i < len(values):
        current = queue.pop(0)
        
        if values[i].strip() != "null":
            current.left = TreeNode(int(values[i].strip()))
            queue.append(current.left)
        i += 1
        
        if i < len(values) and values[i].strip() != "null":
            current.right = TreeNode(int(values[i].strip()))
            queue.append(current.right)
        i += 1
    return root

if __name__ == "__main__":
    tree_input = input().strip()
    root = buildTree(tree_input)
    sol = Solution()
    result = sol.maxDepth(root)
    print(result)
